search.query: | tstats values(host) AS host WHERE `set_cribl_internal_log_index()` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` | mvexpand host | sort host | lookup cribl_stream_workers worker AS host | search worker_group=$worker_group$

div.style: font-family: Arial; font-size: 11pt; list-style-type: square; text-align: center;
div.p: This dashboard is intended to show if your current architecture is sufficient to handle the amount of data being processed by your deployment. After choosing a Worker Node host, CPU speed and CPU architecture, click the Submit button. It will provide you with your current Worker Process count, estimated processing throughput per vCPU and total estimated processing throughput per Worker Node. To determine if you are currently undersized, examine the estimated Worker Processes required panel. If the estimated Worker Process count exceeds your currently available number, this is one indication of being undersized. The remaining panels will show you the amount of time in %, during the selected time range, that the Worker Processes exceeded 90% cpuPerc usage and eluPerc usage. If these numbers are at or above 90%, you should consider upsizing your deployment.

p.b: For more information regarding Sizing and Scaling, please visit our Documentation:
Please also see our Cribl Stream Sizing Calculator:

p.i: Please note that this doesn't take any Data Processing Requirements into consideration.

search.query: `set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | stats dc(cid) AS WorkerProcessCount BY host | stats sum(WorkerProcessCount) AS WorkerProcessCount

panel.title: Estimated Total Throughput per Worker Node

search.query: `set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | bin span=1d _time | stats sum(inBytes) AS inBytes sum(outBytes) AS outBytes by _time | eval totalGB=round((('inBytes' + 'outBytes') / 1024 / 1024 / 1024), 0) | timechart span=1d max(totalGB) AS "Total Throughput (GB)"

`set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | bin span=1d _time | stats sum(inBytes) AS inBytes sum(outBytes) AS outBytes by _time | eval inGB=round(('inBytes' / 1024 / 1024 / 1024), 0) | eval outGB=round(('outBytes' / 1024 / 1024 / 1024), 0) | eval calculation=(round(((('inGB' + 'outGB') * 1024) / $processingLimitPerCPU$), 0) + 1) | timechart span=1d max(calculation) AS "Estimated Worker Processes Required"

panel.title: Estimated Worker Processes Required, Based on DAILY Throughput over the Selected Time Range

search.query: `set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | bin span=1d _time | stats sum(inBytes) AS inBytes sum(outBytes) AS outBytes by _time | eval date = strftime(_time, "%Y-%m-%d") | eval inGB = round((inBytes / 1024 / 1024 / 1024), 0) | eval outGB = round((outBytes / 1024 / 1024 / 1024), 0) | eval totalGB = (inGB + outGB) | eval wpRequired = (round(('totalGB' / $processingLimitPerCPU$), 0) + 1) | table date inGB outGB totalGB wpRequired | rename date AS Date inGB AS "GB In" outGB AS "GB Out" totalGB AS "Total GB" wpRequired AS "Estimated Worker Processes Required"

panel.title: Percentage, over the Selected Time Range, that a Worker Process Exceeded 90% cpuPerc Usage

search.query: `set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | bin span=1m _time | stats max(cpuPerc) AS cpuPerc BY _time cid | eval percentage=if(cpuPerc >= 90, 1, 0) | stats sum(percentage) AS percentage count BY cid | eval percentage=round(((percentage * 100) / count), 2) | eval workerProcess=ltrim(cid, "w") | sort 0 workerProcess | fields cid percentage | rename cid AS CID percentage AS Percentage

panel.title: Percentage, over the Selected Time Range, that a Worker Process exceeded 90% eluPerc Usage

search.query: `set_cribl_internal_log_index` `set_cribl_log_sourcetype` host=$host$ worker_group=$worker_group$ channel="server" message="_raw stats" | bin span=1m _time | stats max(eluPerc) AS eluPerc BY _time cid | eval percentage = if(eluPerc >= 90, 1, 0) | stats sum(percentage) AS percentage count BY cid | eval percentage = round(((percentage * 100) / count), 2) | eval workerProcess = ltrim(cid, "w") | sort 0 workerProcess | fields cid percentage | rename cid AS CID percentage AS Percentage
